timeline.bodyText:
I'd choose a better-fitting name for this method. It's not a "read-only" get, I think its intent is to populate the request based on given action, so maybe populateRequestFromAction, setupRequestFromAction, ... would be better.


The logic is non-trivial and the reader should get some idea, what's going on, when the aid has been passed (which happens, when we're forwarding from the action page, IIUC). That's why I'd suggest:

a comment in that if block from which this method is called
a javadoc for this method
both
timeline.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText: You are right I should add some comments about whats going on here
replies.author: parlt91

timeline.bodyText: Nit: you could use a shortcut here: Channel.isBaseChannel().
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: IIUC, the addon products of this product set will always be empty, which means empty list will be passed to the request on line 490. Is this intention?
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: Nit: I think camelCase would be more readable.
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: Would it be possible to check for STATUS_COMPLETED && typedistupgradedryrun to restrict the forward to SP Migration only to the cases when the action is completed and we deal with dry run?
timeline.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText: Well the button wouldn't show otherwise and that code would not be executed anyway, but for consistency I will add the check here as well. 👍
replies.author: parlt91

timeline.message:
Add suggested changes

Signed-off-by: Pascal Arlt <parlt@suse.com>

timeline.bodyText: The getMigrationTargets evokes something that doesn't have side-effects. I think that at least a comment in javadoc about populating that MISSING_SUCCESSOR_EXTENSIONS attribute would be good.
timeline.author: hustodemon
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -469,7 +460,38 @@ private SUSEProductSet createProductSet(Long baseProduct, Long[] addonProducts)
         return channelIDs;
     }
 
-    private String getActionDetails(HttpServletRequest request, RequestContext ctx) {
+    /**
+     * Gets list of available migration targets for given ProductSet
+     *
+     * @param request
+     * @param ctx
+     * @param server
+     * @param installedProducts
+     * @return
+     */
+    private List<SUSEProductSet> getMigrationTargets(HttpServletRequest request, RequestContext ctx, Server server,

timeline.bodyText:
I'd suggest being more specific in the method arguments:

instead of ctx you can pass the user directly,
instead of the server, you can pass channelArch directly.

Passing more specific params makes their purpose more clear here.
